summary.long: Zephaniah is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: A word of Jehovah that hath been unto Zephaniah son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hezikiah, in the days of Josiah son of Amoz, king of Judah:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I utterly consume all from off the face of the ground, An affirmation of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I consume man and beast, I consume fowl of the heavens, and fishes of the sea, And the stumbling-blocks -- the wicked, And I have cut off man from the face of the ground, An affirmation of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And stretched out My hand against Judah, And against all inhabiting Jerusalem, And cut off from this place the remnant of Baal, The name of the idolatrous priests, with the priests,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those bowing themselves On the roofs to the host of the heavens, And those bowing themselves, Swearing to Jehovah, and swearing by Malcham,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And those removing from after Jehovah, And who have not sought Jehovah, nor besought Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hush! because of the Lord Jehovah, For near [is] a day of Jehovah, For prepared hath Jehovah a sacrifice, He hath sanctified His invited ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it hath come to pass, In the day of the sacrifice of Jehovah, That I have laid a charge on the heads, And on sons of the king, And on all putting on strange clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have laid a charge on every one Who is leaping over the threshold in that day, Who are filling the house of their masters [With] violence and deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there hath been in that day, An affirmation of Jehovah, The noise of a cry from the fish-gate, And of a howling from the Second, And of great destruction from the hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Howl, ye inhabitants of the hollow place, For cut off hath been all the merchant people, Cut off have been all bearing silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it hath come to pass, at that time, I search Jerusalem with lights, And I have laid a charge on the men Who are hardened on their preserved things, Who are saying in their heart: Jehovah doth no good, nor doth He evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their wealth hath been for a spoil, And their houses for desolation, And they have built houses, and do not inhabit, And they have planted vineyards, And they do not drink their wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Near [is] the great day of Jehovah, Near, and hasting exceedingly, The noise of the day of Jehovah, Bitterly shriek there doth a mighty one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A day of wrath [is] that day, A day of adversity and distress, A day of waste and desolation, A day of darkness and gloominess, A day of cloud and thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A day of trumpet and shouting against the fenced cities, And against the high corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have sent distress to men, And they have walked as the blind, For against Jehovah they have sinned, And poured out is their blood as dust, And their flesh [is] as dung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even their silver, even their gold, Is not able to deliver them in a day of the wrath of Jehovah, And in the fire of His jealousy consumed is the whole land, For only a hastened end doth He make Of all the inhabitants of the land!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bend yourselves, yea, bend ye, O nation not desired,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the bringing forth of a statute, As chaff hath the day passed on, While yet not come in upon you doth the heat of the anger of Jehovah, While yet not come in upon you doth a day of the anger of Jehovah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seek Jehovah, all ye humble of the land, Who His judgment have done, Seek ye righteousness, seek humility, It may be ye are hidden in a day of the anger of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Gaza is forsaken, And Ashkelon [is] for a desolation, Ashdod! at noon they do cast her forth, And Ekron is rooted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ho! O inhabitants of the sea-coast, Nation of the Cherethites, A word of Jehovah [is] against you, Canaan, land of the Philistines, And I have destroyed thee without an inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sea-coast hath been habitations, Cottages [for] shepherds, and folds [for] a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the coast hath been for the remnant of the house of Judah, By them they have pleasure, In houses of Ashkelon at even they lie down, For inspect them doth Jehovah their God, And He hath turned back [to] their captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have heard the reproach of Moab, And the revilings of the sons of Ammon, Wherewith they reproached My people, And magnify [themselves] against their border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I live, An affirmation of Jehovah of Hosts, God of Israel, Surely, Moab is as Sodom, And the sons of Ammon as Gomorrah, An overrunning of nettles and salt-pits, And a desolation -- unto the age. A residue of My people do seize them, And a remnant of My nation inherit them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This [is] to them for their arrogancy, Because they have reproached, And they magnify [themselves] against the people of Jehovah of Hosts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fearful [is] Jehovah against them, For He made bare all gods of the land, And bow themselves to Him, each from his place, Do all islanders of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also ye, O Cushim, pierced of My sword [are] they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He stretcheth His hand against the north, And doth destroy Asshur, And he setteth Nineveh for a desolation, A dry land like a wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And crouched in her midst have droves, Every beast of the nation, Both pelican and hedge-hog in her knobs lodge, A voice doth sing at the window, `Destruction [is] at the threshold, For the cedar-work is exposed.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This [is] the exulting city that is dwelling confidently, That is saying in her heart, `I [am], and beside me there is none,' How hath she been for a desolation, A crouching-place for beasts, Every one passing by her doth hiss, He doth shake his hand!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wo [to] the rebellious and polluted, The oppressing city!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She hath not hearkened to the voice, She hath not accepted instruction, In Jehovah she hath not trusted, Unto her God she hath not drawn near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her heads in her midst [are] roaring lions, Her judges [are] evening wolves, They have not gnawn the bone in the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her prophets unstable -- men of treachery, Her priests have polluted the sanctuary, They have violated the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah [is] righteous in her midst, He doth not do perverseness, Morning by morning His judgment he giveth to the light, It hath not been lacking, And the perverse doth not know shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have cut off nations, Desolated have been their chief ones, I have laid waste their out-places without any passing by, Destroyed have been their cities, Without man, without inhabitant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have said: Only, ye do fear Me, Ye do accept instruction, And her habitation is not cut off, All that I have appointed for her, But they have risen early, They have corrupted all their doings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, wait for Me -- an affirmation of Jehovah, For the day of My rising for prey, For My judgment [is] to gather nations, To assemble kingdoms, To pour out on them Mine indignation, All the heat of Mine anger, For by the fire of My jealousy consumed is all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For then do I turn unto peoples a pure lip, To call all of them by the name of Jehovah, To serve Him [with] one shoulder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From beyond the rivers of Cush, my supplicants, The daughter of My scattered ones, Do bring My present.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day thou art not ashamed because of any of thine actions, Wherewith thou hast transgressed against Me, For then do I turn aside from thy midst The exulting ones of thine excellency, And thou dost add no more to be haughty, In My holy mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I have left in thy midst a people humble and poor, And they have trusted in the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The remnant of Israel do no perversity, nor speak lies, Nor found in their mouth is a deceitful tongue, For they have delight, and have lain down, And there is none troubling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry aloud, O daughter of Zion, shout, O Israel, Rejoice and exult with the whole heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah hath turned aside thy judgments, He hath faced thine enemy, The king of Israel, Jehovah, [is] in thy midst, Thou seest evil no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In that day it is said to Jerusalem, `Fear not, O Zion, let not thy hands be feeble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehovah thy God [is] in thy midst, A mighty one doth save, He rejoiceth over thee with joy, He doth work in His love, He joyeth over thee with singing.'
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mine afflicted from the appointed place I have gathered, from thee they have been, Bearing for her sake reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Lo, I am dealing with all afflicting thee at that time, And I have saved the halting one, And the driven out ones I do gather, And have set them for a praise and for a name, In all the land of their shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time I bring you in, Even at the time of My assembling you, For I give you for a name, and for a praise, Among all peoples of the land, In My turning back [to] your captivity before your eyes, said Jehovah!
verses.speaker: Narrator
